intro: Lastrea karwinskiana, commonly known as the Karwinski's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
